page.title: 12Adisham Health and Welfare
page.content: Adisham district seems a healthy place in which to live, several people over eighty are remarkably active and fit. Villagers chose a doctor from one of the surrounding villages, who visit if they are unable to attend surgery. The doctor's arrange for visits by the District Nurse or Midwife, if required, as these Nurses cover a wide area. People have to go to Canterbury for any hospital treatment or dentistry. The Area Health Authority hold a Child Wel- fare Clinic once a month in the village with a Doctor, Health Visitor and Nurse, for children under five. Some elderly residents are taken by ambulance, to a Day Centre in Canter- bury, once or twice a week. Concern was expressed because there was no doctor resident in the village. Veterinary care for animals also has to come from outside the area.
